content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, a new Genesis fitness theme, building a landing page with Genesis and Advanced Custom Fields, and Tonya Mork wants to send you to bootcamp.

Themes

First up this week, a new premium theme release aimed at the fitness industry, Workout Pro from Matt Whiteley.

WorkoutPro is finally complete! Built for #genesiswp. Available on @creativepxmedia. #studiopress https://t.co/svRlpjaNYF

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) April 9, 2017

Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 announces her latest premium theme, Refined.

Introducing Refined, our newest and most flexible theme to date! https://t.co/m99hpHmApW #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/1TwGZaPbh2

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) April 12, 2017

Brian Gardner with the latest preview of his Monochrome Pro theme.

Here’s an update to the Monochrome Pro theme I’m designing —> https://t.co/IiKlYE0mve #GenesisWP

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) April 12, 2017

Calvin Koepke pushes up an update to his Starter Theme for Genesis.

Speaking of #genesiswp, just pushed v1.1.0 to master. Added sourcemaps, better responsive menu, and logs –> https://t.co/iw2ksKOXQx

— Calvin (@cjkoepke) April 11, 2017

And speaking of starter themes, Chris Mcintosh has also pushed some updates to his Bolt Pro starter theme too and it looks pretty sweet.

Made updates to the Bolt-Pro theme. Like Foundation 6 & working w/ Genesis Framework? Merry Christmas https://t.co/yOPNgOu9Gm #genesiswp

— Chris Mcintosh (@akamac) April 13, 2017

Best of the rest

A new guide from WPML (the popular multilingual WordPress plugin) on using WPML with Genesis.

How to translate Genesis Framework into different languages using WPML?

Andrea Whitmer shows you how to build a Genesis landing page with Advanced Custom Fields.

New post! How to Build a #genesiswp Landing Page with Advanced Custom Fields https://t.co/2EEQHzZGWO

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) April 10, 2017

Justin Sternberg has a snippet for adding CMB2 metaboxes to the Genesis custom post type archive settings page.

Fresh snippet for the #genesiswp folks: Add CMB2 metaboxes to Genesis CPT Archive settings pages: https://t.co/jGsv7uYelm

— Justin Sternberg (@Jtsternberg) April 12, 2017

Tonya Mork over at Know The Code (which has a huge amount of free Genesis video tutorials if you haven’t seen) is planning a doing a live event later this year.

Introducing the Profitable #WordPress Developer Bootcamp, where you will develop your business & technical expertise https://t.co/zIegyfcahf

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) April 12, 2017

Billed as a WordPress developer bootcamp, here’s what we know so far…

  1. Tentative dates are Oct 9-13, 2017
  2. It may be live streamed also
  3. Confirmed teachers and special guests include:
  • Chris Lema Oct. 9-10th
  • Alain Schlesser – all week
  • Tom McFarlin – all week
  • Carl Alexander – all week
  • Zac Gordon – all week

so @hellofromTonya, @chrislema, @twigpress, @schlessera, & others are looking at hosting a #wordpress bootcamp. https://t.co/kFZK9SbYaK 👌🏻 pic.twitter.com/1hrcyCuCxN

— Tom McFarlin (@tommcfarlin) April 14, 2017

Proud to be part of the Profitable #WordPress Developer Bootcamp!
If you want to jump the queue to profitability, sign up right now! https://t.co/THeX4pusDh

— Alain Schlesser (@schlessera) April 14, 2017

If you’re interested make sure you drop your email address over at the landing page for the event now.

And finally…

Congrats to Susan Ramsey on making the Genesis recommended developers list. Very well deserved!

This just happened…

Thanks to @bgardner @laurenmancke & the team at @studiopress and to @lindseyriel for cheering me on! #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/wfr4AXowdJ

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) April 13, 2017
